title: Social Comparison Theory Mechanism Testing
setup: Randomized controlled trial simulation with 100 adolescents across 4 conditions testing mechanism-specific interventions vs usage reduction
results: SUCCESS: 5/5 criteria met. Comparison intervention (d=0.73) significantly outperformed usage reduction (d=0.42). Strong mediation evidence (r=0.68). Clinical significance achieved with combined intervention (4.15-point BDI-II reduction).
notes: First experimental validation of mechanism-targeted social media interventions. Paradigm shift from behavior modification to psychological mechanism targeting. High adherence rates (73-81%) demonstrate feasibility.

title: Cross-Cultural Platform Feature Impact Analysis
setup: 3x2x4 quasi-experimental design with 600 adolescents from USA and India testing platform features across cultural contexts with validated mental health measures
results: SUCCESS: 3/3 criteria met. Strong cultural moderation effect (d=0.67) with Indian adolescents showing greater resilience. Cultural protective factors significantly buffer negative effects (India r=-0.41 vs USA r=-0.23). High-intensity filters and engagement algorithms showed strongest negative impacts.
notes: Evidence for culturally-informed platform design and scalable cultural protective factor interventions. Framework validated for cross-cultural platform research. Wellness-focused algorithms demonstrated protective effects.
